result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 052529,
Payable Number: 580859,
Receipt Number: 22RS048194,
Amount: $20.00
Media Request for Cameras in the Courtroom - WISC TV ***APPROVED****

Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can  be outfitted directly by Pretrial Services with any required equipment prior to the defendant being released from the jail. (PRIOR APPROVAL BY PRETRIAL SERVICES REQUIRED) 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ELH. 
- Defendant shall not be at or around 3425 S Stonecreek Cir in Madison.
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of ELH.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

1:32 PM Defendant Alexander David Devicente Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Derek W Brown in court for Alexander David Devicente Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
